column4: can anyone point me to the contents of the ubuntu install DVD's? I've searched the wiki and forums with no results.
what do you mean?  Please rephrase your question.
I need to know what packages are on the DVD to see if it will help me with my problem
no, i don't. I've got to use ndiswrapper-utils for my wireless before I can get net access with linux
so, I've got to see if that package is on the DVD
it should autorun so you can browse it under window, but you'll h ave to know the specific filesnames of the packages you are looking for.
I haven't downloaded it yet. I want to make sure it's worth the several hours it's going to take to download. and, I've searched ubuntu.com
I could, or I could just go to work Friday and use the LAN. I'd rather not spend my time at work though
the DVD is 2.8 Billion bytes and the rest of the available packages are on repositories or CVS.
I won't have internet access until my wireless is working. so I don't have access to those repositories unless the ndiswrapper-utils package is on that DVD
why don't you just d/l the ndiswrapper source while you're dling the Breezy ISO -- then youknow you have it for sure.  I'll check my apt-cache too for you.
because I have no idea how to compile it, and that leaves tons of room for error on my part
can't you just the darn thing inwhile installing so you can pull your Broadcom gak (or whatever) directly off the repos on t3h Intarweb?
I meant at work -- you said you were going to go there anyhow
did you catch what he said?
